title: People who think Voice Coms will improve League
body:
Have never played Halo, GoW, Graw, TF2, CoD, CS:GO or any other PvP game with voice communications (many of these games must have it due to format, lack of pings and no keyboard). It is worst of all on Free To Play games like this.

What you will get:
Mouth breathers
Foreign langauges
The guy who thinks everyone wants to hear his music
The shitty $2 mic
Dogs barking
Yelling family members
The sports playing in the background
Screaming flamers
The guy who yells one profane word all game over and over
The kid yelling at his mom to make him a PBJ
Kids trying to swear and sound cool
The voice emulator "girl" who acts hot
The guy that moans all game
The people who spam yell instructions at you
Everyone thinking they are team "captain"
People having screaming arguments about KDAs and plays
People discriminating against people's voices or speech patterns
11 year old voices cracking "AHH GET SHIT ON SCRUBS!"
Morality speeches from support players
People blasting your ears out anytime they die/get a kill
"GAAAAANKKSS WTF!" Vocalized
The guy who plays the game and voices over his speakers and uses a mic
The person who intentionally feedbacks the audio when doing bad
The person who blares porn over the mic

How it will affect teamplay:
Fewer people will properly use pings and chat
People in voice chat will buddy up against those not using it
The one out of 100 lucky team to properly utilize it will stomp the other
Lag
More intentional trolling/feeding

Benefits it will bring:
Once on a blue moon a team will use it correctly and get slightly boosted performance.

For me. I have no interest in hearing it, using it, having it used or knowing it exists. I'd rather immerse myself in the game and music, and have fun. Playing competitive games with voicecom before it is pure cancer and is NEVER used right. The only people who think it is good at either delusional ones who think anybody was paying attention to the orders they barked or genuinely ignorant people who have never played games with voicecoms. It is all the immaturity of the Internet and shitty personalities pounded into your ear with a 1/100 game benefit that will split communication ruining teamplay further.

https://youtu.be/ewmg0uXU2cM

#For those saying what has already been addressed
"Mute" doesn't fix what happens to the now divided communication system voice chat would create. The options are:

A: Deal with cancer.

B: Turn it off and deal with reduced communication as people forget what pings and chat is.

C: Selectively mute 99% of people encountered.

Whereas no voice chat everyone is on an even playing field for communication with pings and chatbar. Things far less toxic where the worst you get is "?" Ping or some easily ignored text without breaking game immersion.

Because people like me will not use this, and the people who will will completely ignore chat and will rarely use pings and expect us to follow their lead because they're expecting everyone to be in voice coms. If they add this, they better give us an option to disable it from the client so I will never have to deal with this.

Disabling doesn't help. That just means people that _do_ use it can't communicate with you.  So what if they actually having something useful to say like a warning of your lane being ganked?  You didn't hear anything, and you're in danger because of it.   Now consider the situation where you _are_ using it, find the stereotypical Xbox rager, mute them, but only you and one other person muted them.  They're still screaming unintelligible nonsense while you and the other guy are trying to make calls.  The other two teammates don't hear anything over the shrieking, and they don't know what the plan is.  

I know Riot wants to put this in since Tryndamere is still under this delusion of grandeur that League will be a global sport that lasts generations, and sports have good communication, but this simply won't end well.  Those who want voice chat can find third party platforms to use - don't force it on everyone.

Well then this would break communication like I mentioned in my original comment.

We can clearly see evidence of this in Discord premades. The players out of the loop rarely if ever get real communication.

Imo, if you want voice com, use Discord. They went through a lot of work to reduce overhead anyway.

Besides, using chat improves your WPM.

I _personally_ have never had a problem with voice comms in team games. It actually struck me as odd that League didn't have it. 

Honestly, it still does. I play DotA2 and Overwatch fairly regularly and use the voice comms there just fine and it's jarring to even just mess around on League and only be able to ping if I'm not in a position to type my intent. 

A lot of people dislike voice comms, but a lot of people like it. Is what it is, on both sides.

I can't wait for all of the buyer's remorse if voice chat is integrated. If only someone would have been there to warn you guys.  If only there were a group of people who have played games with voice coms to remind people what to expect.  If only there were examples of what voice chat does a competitive game...oh wait, there was...for multiple years since this started being a topic of discussion.  

The best thing to expect from this is those same people who have been wanting voice chat since season 3 immediately wanting it gone after they find out what they've done.
